intro: Hedythyrsus katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga hedythyrsus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy surface. Hedythyrsus katangensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
